Key Match Events: Greece won 3-0 against Finland with Ioannidis scoring two goals and Kallman scoring an own goal for Finland.
Koulierakis (51'), Konstantelias (67'), Zafeiris (90+3') also scored for Greece.
Pre-Game Insights: Greece are under new management with Ivan Jovanovic, who replaced Gus Poyet.
Finland have won seven of their last 13 away competitive games, but their gameplan has been anything but pragmatic in recent years.
Greece's national team attendances have not been fantastic for Greece of late, with less than 200 spectators at their last match against New Zealand.
Post-Match Reflections: Greece won their first match in League B under new management.
Finland struggled to cope with Greece's attacking play and conceded three goals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Greece's win was their first in the UEFA Nations League since 2018.
Finland's defeat was their fifth in the UEFA Nations League.
Others: Greece's team news includes Konstantinos Tzolakis potentially replacing Odysseas Vlachodimos as the number one goalkeeper.
Finland's team news includes Teemu Pukki starting up front to make his 123rd cap.
